User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101130 Firefox/3.5.16
Build Identifier: 3.1


Previous versions affected as well

Saved search folders will be more user friendly if to enable them to show
the properties dialog just on one double-click.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
See details
Actual Results:  
Time consuming procedure needed to get the Properties dialog of saved search folders displayed:
- select the saved search folder
- invoke its context menu
- point with mouse to the lowest position of context menu
- click on the "Properties" position

Expected Results:  
Double-click the saved search folder in order to get presented its 
properties dialog.

comments.raw_text:
right+click on folder, then properties, is two mouse clicks and one mouse move (the first click on folder is a given). Which is basically one less action (out of three) than double click. So unless I'm missing something I don't see a significant productivity gain.

Plus, double click function is "the standard" for springing folders open and close. Although, there probably will never be a need for a virtual folder to collapse. 

There is however the question of, how often do edit saved searches? And why is it so frequent (assuming it is)?

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> There is however the question of, how often do edit saved searches? And why is
> it so frequent (assuming it is)?

As for me frequently.
Because search folders like following used
"search for <string> in folder(s) XYZ (XYZ, YZX, XYZ, XZY)"
or 
"search for <message-ID> in folder(s) XYZ (XYZ, YZX, XYZ, XZY)"
where XYZ XYZ, YZX, XYZ, XZY are fixed folder names.
where <string> and <message-ID> change in the search by search cycle

I do see high productivity gain.
